description: The Department of Energy manages the United States' nuclear infrastructure and administers the country's energy policy. The Department of Energy also funds scientific research in the field.
name: Department of Energy

departments.description: The Office of Scientific and Technical Information collects, preserves, and makes available the results of research and development carried out or sponsored by the Department of Energy.
departments.name: Office of Scientific and Technical Information
National Nuclear Security Administration Service Center
National Nuclear Security Administration Office of Naval Reactors
Carlsbad Field Office – Waste Isolation Pilot Program
Bonneville Power Administration
departments.description: The Bonneville Power Administration creates and delivers a reliable power supply to the Pacific Northwest.

departments.name: Southeastern Power Administration
departments.description: The Southeastern Power Administration markets hydroelectric power generated by federal reservoirs to public entities in the southeastern United States.

departments.name: Southwestern Power Administration
departments.description: The Southwestern Power Administration markets hydroelectric power generated by federal dams to public entities in several states in the south and southwest.
The Western Area Power Administration markets hydroelectric power generated by federal dams and associated services to public entities in the Western United States.
departments.name: Western Area Power Administration
